text: WE MEET: MUMBLES(late 30s) and ONE TWO (late 30s). They a listening to a sales pitch from two REAL ESTATE AGENTS. We SEE all the relevant pictures of their pitch explainin changing city, LONDON.
Two years ago this property cost one million pounds. (we SEE building)

Today, it costs five million. The camera WHIP PANS over to another part of the building see the other ESTATE AGENT giving his pitch. The camera will keep this back and forth for the duration of the sce
How did this happen? (CUT TO relevant pictures as he speaks)
Attractive tax opportunities for foreign investment, restrictive building consent and massive hedge fund bonuses,... (beat)
London, my good man, is fast becoming the financial and cultural capital of the world.
And of course the Russians have come to town.
Makes it hard to compete with an ex- Soviet oligarch that has six billion dollars in his back pocket. They don't haggle the price, they double the price.
Russians come, prices rise, and it doesn't stop. It only goes one way.
Up.
I can't teach you how to skin a cat, but I can tell you a lot about the money in bricks and mortar.
PINK Revision    -   6-20-07
Like he said, it's going one way. You need to see a lawyer.
PINK Revision    -   6-19-07
One Two and Mumbles look at one another.
We need to see a Lawyer.
CUT TO a modern looking LAWYER'S office.   We SEE the LAW advising MUMBLES AND ONE TWO.
They say it's only going one way.
ONE TWO and the LAWYER are here looking at the building, is a bit dilapidated and bleak.
It looks like a great deal.
We cut back into the office where the LAWYER lays out the building plans.
These are the plans,...it costs ten and it'll be worth twenty with planning. But first you gotta give the councilor a drink.
CUT TO the desk of a COUNCILOR (mid thirties middle management)who is receiving a brown envelope from the LAW
(off the envelope)
Tell them they'll get the planning,...
We CUT BACK to our LAWYER now smug.    One Two and Mumble standing in front of him.
You'll get the planning. Take care of the councilor and it will move like shit through a goose.
PINK Revision   -   6-20-07
We need help.
Lenny Cole?
Dog number one,...
But he moves fast and he loves bricks and mortar.
MEET LENNY COLE(50s, dark, a little tubby), Mumbles and O Two are here. Lenny's office is kitsch, he fancies himsel as a man of class.
I do move fast and I love bricks and mortar, properties are always the safe bet, but you better know what you're doing 'cos this ain't soft money. You trip up,... (beat)
And it's not me that's gonna get hurt. You got security?
We got property.
Don't let me down boys. (beat)
Come on then, give us your hand. They shake hands and sign the papers.
PINK Revision   -   6-19-07
The Councilor is the phone to the Lawyer.      He speaks tones clandestine like.
(into phone)
Can't talk now, but there has been a problem. I can't get you the planning.
The Lawyer is on the phone with Mumbles and One Two.
(into phone)
I'm sorry boys, can't get the planning.
One two is on the phone.      He looks over to Mumbles.
He can't get the planing.
He can't get the planing?
Lenny is looking out to One Two and Mumbles who are stand outside his car looking very white. Lenny screams from th back seat.
What do you mean you can't get the fuckin planning? (pointing)

There is seven million of my cash in there, without planning it's worth five,...you owe me. I take the building, you lose your share, but I am still outta pocket two large ones. Find it. The window goes up and the car pulls off.      Lenny pick his phone, he dials huffing and puffing.
WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07
Is that you Councilor? (Lenny smiles)
I hear you got that car you was after,....now, sort the planning out.
Sorted Lenny. He puts the phone down and looks over smiling.     MEET A (Lenny's right hand man, 50s).
What's wrong with you Arch?
That's a bit strong isn't it Len? They come from the same place as you, you'll clean 'em out.
Same place as me? Do I look like an immigrant Archy? (beat)
No one gave me a leg up, did they? They need a bit of fear, 'cos otherwise they're gonna come up against me,...need a little lesson don't they?
One Two and Mumbles are here, it's quiet until,..
We gotta sell.
And be left with what?
Just gotta start again,.... FADE OUT.
Start CREDITS over sports arena entrance. Lenny is being walked down a corridor, the      walls are with photographs of old soccer stars.
PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                             4

On each side of him are two ESCORTS(ex-military types, he looking). As they pass each door, we realize where ever h is going, it has to be important. The ESCORTS talk in to their microphones and to the different GUARDS on each doo way.
WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07
Every now and then we see the SPORTS ARENA in the back gr At last we reach the main door to the head office.

As the door is opened we see a small crowd of MEN in suit gathered around a kind-looking MAN with bright blue eyes. He nods a couple of times. We CUT TO the front of Lenny who is clearly impressed, Mr Blue eyes pays him no attention. The small crowd of busin MEN shake hands and head to the door at which Lenny is wa patiently.
CLOSE UP on the back of URI (Russian Jew, 40s, slick, and well groomed, he is our Mr. Blue Eyes) overlooking his sp arena. We stay on the back of Uri's head while he is talk to Lenny.
Glad you could join us here Lenny.
It's nice to see you Uri.
Good. (there is a pause)
I can see we are very much alike you and I Lenny. We like to get things done. (beat)
What's it going to cost me?
First, let me make clear how much we can help you benefit from this deal. With out me, it will take you five to ten years to get the permission to erect your arena. (beat)
Second, with Government policy as it so stands we both know it's unlikely that you'd ever get that consent. (beat)
Thirdly, in legal fees, transactions and building consent, you'd be paying 6 to 12 million without any real guarantee of that result. We CUT TO Uri unfazed, he just wants the figure.
PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                           5A
So Lenny,..... how much?
PINK Revision    -   6-19-07
Seven million Euros. Still unfazed.
I expect a guarantee that I have consent within six months and no red tape.
That's right Uri, you can consider that done. Pause while tension stews, then,...
Drink!     Follow me.

Uri walks to the bar. Lenny follows trying to contain his excitement, he's out of his league, a "welcome to the billionaires club" look has struck him pink. Lenny passes PICTURE that's sat on an EASEL.
Oh, that's a nice picture Uri, hasn't it got, errrh depth? Uri is at the bar now. He has placed one large tumbler do and is pouring a very very large measure out.
That picture has brought me nothing but luck Lenny,..it's my lucky picture. (he has a good idea)
You like? Take it for a while, maybe it will give you luck.
Oh I couldn't Uri,... Still absorbed with the painting.

Now we're partners, I insist. I will get it sent around to your house and you can give it back to me when our deal is finalized. Lenny looks at the bar. Uri motions, there is a SMALL KEG of WHISKEY on the bar and only one large glass.
PINK Revision    -   6-20-07
I thought you lot drunk Vodka.
Whiskey is the new Vodka.
You not joining me Uri?
WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07
I don't drink.
Oh,...cheers then,...
To success. Lenny awkwardly starts to glug as Uri looks on.
Lenny enters the back seat of his car, Archy is waiting f him in the back.
You all right there Len?      You look a little pink.
(Flustered)
Turbo, get us a perrier and a wet wipe live-o. Lenny's panting.
Tried to poison me the dirty Cossack... TURBO (Lenny's driver) is fumbling around in the front se trying to get ice into a glass from the cooler that sits beside him.
Stop messing about and give us the bottle Turbo.
So, how's the billionaires club? Lenny grabs the drink, desperately takes a big glug of wa and wipes his face.
That Communism didn't seem to slow 'em down did it? We've hit the big time here Archy boy! (beat)
What's wrong? Where's the old Archy smile?
PINK Revision    -   6-20-07
You wanna watch out there. Times are changing, they don't have too much respect for the old school.
WHITE Revision   -   6-19-07
Shut up Archy,... (under his breath)
No school like the old school,...I still run this town see? That's why he came to me right? Got that?
Yeah, got that.
Uri looks at VICTOR (Uri's right hand man).   They're loo down at Lenny's disappearing car.
You think you should have leant him your lucky picture?
It makes the peasant feel royal,... don't spoil it, we need him at the moment. I want that consent. (beat)
Call the accountant and get her to clear the money.

A man and woman sit on one side of a desk, MEET STELLA AN BERTIE. Bertie is 45 and handsome in a dark posh sort of way. Stella is 32, film star. Sitting opposite them are two TAX MEN(civil servant types, grey, middle aged, a lit tubby and bald). There's a stand off.
Look, can we shut the door? There's a pause while the TAX MAN looks at his colleague.
Shut the door. His colleague gets up and shuts the door.
Let's put our cards on the table. We both know you aren't going to get the full forty out of my clients.
This is the tax office and in the end we get what we want.
PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

Save that speech for the tourists Charlie and let's strike a deal - take the twenty now and let it go. Otherwise, they'll move the company off shore tomorrow and you'll spend the next twenty years chasing an imaginary forty million around every republic that grows bananas.
Bertie lifts out papers from his brief case.
I see why you married her now Bertie.
The two TAX MEN look at each other, they're thinking the same thought.
I told you we'd make a great team,.. You know why you get those deals?
She looks relatively bored.

Because those fat, sad, old men like it when you swear at them. They shake like cocktails and sweat like semtex when you raise that posh little voice. You my love are a rare commodity. (beat) Now come on, give your Bertie a smile.

I don't feel like smiling. I am a thirty two year old accountant married to a homosexual lawyer. (beat) I'm a beard without kids Bertie! I'm in a marriage of convenience that can be quite inconvenient at times.
The phone rings, Bertie picks it up and answers.
Yes, she's right here.
PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                       9A.
(he puts his hand over the receiver) It's Omovich. (mincey) Are you sure he isn't gay?
WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07

Introduction of the SPEELER. A location of all things nefarious, a place to scam, buy and sell things illegal, play cards. MUMBLES and ONE TWO own the Speeler. MEET Handsome Bob (mid thirties, part of the gang Errrh Handso FRED THE HEAD(late 40s) he runs it with DOLLY(early 50s, maternal figure, cleaner and chef). These are the main players in a room of never less than TEN rarely no more t TWENTY people.
You won't do a five, they've got nothing on you Handsome Bob.
What are you talking about Fred? They got an informer, a grass, and a rat with a roach-smoking-a canary,..they've got more information than the fuckin Internet.
Language,...
Well, like I said, nothing.
Leave him alone Fred, you're stressing him out. Dolly get him a cuppa tea. (beat)
Come on deal the cards Fred. We see in the background someone coming in. MEET COOKIE(l 30s, slicked back, black hair), his look is a bit of a pa
All right chaps?
All right Cookie.
Want to be dealt in?
Can't stay for long, but throw us in for a quick spin. One Two, who has been on the phone finishes his call. looks over to Mumbles.
PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                      10A.
Mumbles, can I have a word?
WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07
What's happening?
You know the lady, the posh one who likes abitta the rough life?
The accountant, what about her? You haven't heard from her in a while, too dangerous that one.
Says she's got some work, you know,... proper work. (he makes gun impression)
I would normally turn her down, but considering,...
Let's have a meet.
Stella's here admiring an abstract picture of nothingness One Two sits next to her.
I got one like that at home with a little boy fishing.
Is that what they call humor where you come from?
Well, don't they call that art where you come from?
You're quite the entertainer aren't you Mr. One Two? And you are late, please don't be late, I have a very busy schedule.
They walk down the corridor.
PINK Revision    -    6-20-07
I have some work and thought you'd be interested, its your kind of work.
Go on.
WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07
There are two accountants taking out seven million Euros from a bank I know and it won't be protected. (beat)
Twenty percent for me, as normal. The details are in here. She passes an envelope.
Anything else?
Yes,..I don't want this coming back to me so, if you could give them a black eye,..that might help. She see's a slight pause and look of concern from One Two
A black eye, nothing more. She passes him an envelope.
Ok, very good Mrs. Dexter, a black eye it is then. He looks down at her shoes.
Nice shoes.
(she smiles)
Why thank you, you'll be able to afford your own pair in a couple of days. Good bye. He watches her walk off, he likes her, she likes him.

Two guys are here counting money. MEET ROMAN and MICKEY, two black Americans. (Mid 30s dressed very classy, with a bit of an urban twist) They are in the managing game, exploiting the talents of the English. The sound of distant bass thudding through the walls can heard while Mickey is on the phone trying to do some kind business. A real ROCKER with long hair and good looks com walking in distressed.
WHITE Revision       -   6-6-07
I need the dry ice Mickey, I need the dry ice. My show just doesn't work without it.

(hand over the receiver) If you told me yesterday you needed dry ice, I would have gotten you the driest ice the world could offer, but you didn't ask for no dry ice. You asked for two cases of Johnny Walker black label and four ladies of the pole and I got them for you didn't I?
There's a pause from the Rocker.
Didn't I?
Yes you did I do confess, but Mickey, you're the manager and I am the rocker. You've got on the managers hat, now pluck something out of it.

My hat is deep and full of magic. I got rabbits, handkerchiefs, and ladies of the pole drinking Black Label. I got smoke machines, bubble machines, I even got love marines and still the hat goes deeper, but....there ain't no mother fuckin dry ice.
Ok, ok, come home, you've made your point. (he turns on his way out) But tomorrow, I need dry ice.
ROMAN looks up from his paper, having not got involved in the slightest. Roman taps the paper he has been reading.
Have you read this?
What?
He reads out the headlines.
WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07
Johnny Story singer extraordinaire, fell off a boat, they say. Missing, assumed dead, they say.
What,..our Johnny?
How many rock stars by the name of Johnny Story do you think there are in this universe Mickey?

The only thing he's fallen off is his junkies spoon, he's no deader than the suit you're wearing now. He'll be gearing himself up somewhere happy as clam in a fisherman's net. Rockers like that never die, they just wither and give me pain.

On the tennis court we see the COUNCILOR(our man from the beginning), who is playing tennis with TERRY THE INSTRUCT The Councilor is taking it seriously apart from the distraction of JACKIE on the next door court. ARCHY is he watching over the game and reading the paper, we see him read an article and look a little moved. Lenny comes up behind him and starts to read over his shoulder.
Johnny Story singer extraordinare, fell off a boat, missing, assumed dead.
I don't know what to say Lenny.
I bet he took a lot of people with him in his hot little crack pipe. (beat)
We will never mention this again, all right Arch? Archy looks a little shocked.     Lenny carries on like n has happened.
Now, tell the Councilor to stop fuckin about with sticks and balls and send him inside.
PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                            14
Lenny walks into the bar and Archy moves on to the court.
WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07
Very good councilor, you must of had lessons as a boy. (beat)
Fancy a cool down and a chat with Lenny? The Councilor slyly looks over to Jackie, she looks back. The Councilor is thinking explicit thoughts.
Do you know Jackie? Nervous, the Councilor knows these thugs aren't shy.
No, no, no, Archy, don't say anything.
Don't worry, she's a friend,..and a member. (raises his voice)
Jackie,..fancy a run'a'round with the Councilor? Pause.   She looks sullen, stroppy and rude all at the sa time.
Only if he's wicked. She turns away to hit a ball, the Councilor's heart skips beat.
(excited and shy)
What does she mean by that?
I think she likes you boy-o.
Lenny is at the bar on his own looking at the papers and picking at the nuts. In walks the Councilor with Archy, t Councilor sits next to Lenny at the bar.
They say that times are changing Councilor, that this country isn't what it used to be, it's the new New York, they say. You being a political man must know all about that.
PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                          15A.
The Councilor looks a bit flustered.
WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07
Errh, I think they are probably right, times have changed, but that shouldn't affect you Lenny.
They say it's all gone "international" now, out with the old guard in with the new, but I think they're wrong. (beat)
Anyway, where are my manners? Look at you sweaty as a native and pink as a pelican,...and I haven't even offered you a wet one.
A lemonade and orange please.
Oh that's nice,..refreshing, that'll put you back on top boy. Lenny pulls out the plans and a leather pack of cigars.
Here you go, plans and papers. (beat)
Would you like a cigar?
I don't mind if I do,...that's a nice lighter.
Eight grand they wanted for it cheeky toads and I paid, you know why?
Tell me Lenny.
'Cos it's all about the details. Looking at the plans.
(awkwardly)
Is our little deal in there too Lenny? Lenny milks the silence while he lights his cigar, the Councilor feels like a prick waiting, it goes on and on.
PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                           16
Oh I wouldn't forget that, the most important things first.
PINK Revision    -   6-19-07
He puts the Dunhill lighter down on the plans.
I'll leave you with them. (beat)
I gotta run, can't stay here chewing the fat all day, a mans got to make a living. Call me in the 'morrow. He walks toward the door as Jackie is walking in, Lenny l slyly at her as they pass.
Look after him Jackie. In the distance.
Oh Lenny, you forgot your lighter. Lenny looks back to the Councilor.
Can't be mine, it's got your name on it. CUT TO the bottom of the lighter, "THE COUNCILOR." Lenny carries on walking and smiling.
It's the next morning, we SEE One Two running. Mumbles an Handsome Bob pull up along side of him in their car. Ther is a moment of pause while they admire One Two running al side of them.
Don't you get bored of that? I mean, your not really going anywhere. If you wanna run, why don't you run to the shops or do something useful?
You could do with some of this yourself Mumbles, you're letting yourself go. (beat)
Anyway, I'm busy, have you come to talk about anything important?
It's all about the zone isn't it?
PINK Revision    -   6-20-07
You boys and girls like to find funny places in your head where nothing can get you, don't you? You're scared, you're running away from yourself One Two.
No Mumbles, I am trying to run away from you. Bob, you sorted out the car?
PINK Revision    -   6-19-07
Yeah, it looks like a heap of shit, but it can't half go. (beat)
A bit like you One Two. Mumbles turns to Handsome Bob
I reckon he's trying to get fit for the lady. Nothing gets under his skin like a lady he can't have, does it? (pause)
A straight going, cocky, educated, arrogant posh bird trips him right up. I reckon we should set Handsome Bob on her. That'll liven you up One Two.
Bob wouldn't know where to begin.
I'm good with the posh ones, don't you worry about that.
I've had enough of this, can you two piss off cos I am trying to find my "zone" One Two sprints off leaving them behind.
He can't half run for a white fella.
Lenny is pacing in a ladies dressing gown with long silk socks. He can't sleep, he pours a large one, lights a cig picks up the phone and dials.
Archy? You awake? (beat)
Never mind, you are now. I had a horrible dream that the Councilor didn't come through, I don't want anything going wrong on this one, that Russian's the key to the big time. (pause)
You think he's all right?
PINK Revision    -   6-19-07
(beat) You sure? (beat) What did Jackie say?
His feet go back up on the desk with confidence.

She did? I knew he'd like the lighter, nice touch eh? She's a good girl that Jackie. (laughing) Give her another drink. (beat) You're right, he wouldn't have leant me his lucky painting if he didn't mean business. Yeah, I had it taken off it's easel and stuck it above my desk, it's looks magnifi....
He suddenly stops. His eyes have spotted something scary, the office chair disappears from under him, he takes the phone, the lamp, and the ash tray with him to the floor.
(from the floor) Arch! Arch! I have been robbed.
He turns the receiver the right way round.
I said I have been robbed. (beat) I don't know when. The painting,.. it's gone.
He stands fumbling and screaming, his scotch all over him
The one Uri gave me! (beat) All right LOANED for fucks sake!
Beat while panic sets in and Archy is saying something on the other end.
This isn't good Arch, it's his favorite painting, his lucky painting! Get round here and bring the troops.
PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                            19
Lenny's still pacing, a small gathering of tired looking HOOLIGANS are lined up in Lenny's office.
Where was it Len? Lenny is standing in front of the fire place smoking and looking very anxious.
WHITE Revision    -   6-6-07
There is a bald spot above his head where a picture once stood, a picture light illuminates an clearly empty space He is horrified by the stupidity of the question.

Let's take a wild stab in the dark shall we Bandy? Archy slap him and then send him to school 'cos I can't take any more of this. You sort it out, get that picture back and bring me a body, I am going to back to bed.
He stomps off to bed.
Bandy if you ever ask a stupid question like that again, you see Danny there? He's gonna slap you.
Sorry Arch, it's just,...I was trying to use initiative.
Danny slap him.
DANNY slaps him with the back of his left hand.       Arc happy - it was the wrong hand.
With the right Danny,..properly.
DANNY slaps him again, it's weak.
I said properly, with the back of your right hand Danny.
What is this a tennis match Arch?
Slap him!
DANNY slaps him again, BANDY takes it good. Archy huffs a goes over to slap him proper, SLAP! Bandy's disappeared into another dimension.
Like that!
PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                            2
(beat)
Now, if you men can master a slap like that, there's no need for your clients to hold back. They'll open up like a fountain full of words after one of those.
PINK Revision    -   6-19-07
No need for strong violence, no no, they're straight back to their childhood. Putty in your hands, ask Bandy,... (motioning)
Look, thinks he's back at school.
But he never went to school.
Daniel, do you want a slap as well? Now, if the slap doesn't work,..Cut 'em...or pay 'em, but keep the receipts 'cos this ain't the Mafia. (beat)
Now, get to work and find that painting.

Mumbles, Handsome Bob, and One Two are standing here dres as security guards. Handsome Bob is watching over the car that is waiting for the TWO ACCOUNTANTS to come out of th back door of the warehouse. One Two and Mumbles are to th side.
You ready?

Yup, load up boys and pay attention. One Two see's the door open and makes a move. Two ACCOUNT come out of the back door, while in route they click thei central locking open on the car waiting. One Two is alrea on them as the ACCOUNTANTS go to open their car door.
Hello lads. He flashes the gun in his belt. The ACCOUNTANTS are too shocked to even know what is going on.
Put the bags in the car and walk away. The ACCOUNTANTS see the gun, but still look for a way out Mumbles meets them with another gun.
PINK Revision    -   6-20-07
Don't be silly boys, do as you are told. Put the bags in the car, give him the keys and walk away smiling.
PINK Revision    -   6-19-07

The ACCOUNTANTS do as they are told. One Two and Mumbles get into the car, calm as you like. One Two, starts the engine, but he can't find reverse. There is a crunching sound from the car, the accountants stop and look round. One Two puts down the window.
(to the accountants)
Oi, come back here. The ACCOUNTANTS come back.
Where's reverse?
You have to lift up the nob under the gear stick. One Two struggles, then finds the gear.
Right, now fuck off.
(to accountants)
Slowly and keep smiling.
Shit,...
What?
I have got to hurt him. (to the Accountants)
Oi come back here.
Why? What did he ever do to you? Come on we've got the money now let's piss off! The Accountant has made his away back to the car.
Yes? One Two goes through the motions getting ready to hit the accountant without actually being able to do it.
Shit, I can't do it.
PINK Revision    -   6-20-07                            2
One Two wheels spins out of there.
Mumbles and One Two take off driving.
(looking)
You're an embarrassment to crime you are.
She asked me to give him a black eye.
She's sick that bird of yours, sick. Quickly changing the subject.
Is Handsome Bob behind?
He's there.
Uri is walking around looking over one his sites, he's entertaining a corporate gathering of MEN all in suits an hard hats.

The developement has been underway for four years and will be completed within another two. The area covers twelve acres and it will become one of Londons premiere residences. We can SEE VICTOR (Uri's right hand man) in the backgroun looking anxious.
Thirty two floors and six acres,....excuse me gentlemen,.. Uri walks over to VICTOR.
What is it?
PINK Revision    -   6-19-07
Victor leans in and whispers to Uri.    After 15 seconds leans back.
(in Russian) Do they know who we are?
(in Russian) It's not like the old country, it's cowboys and Indians out here.
(in Russian) We don't have time to play games,..people and business are waiting. Speak to the accountant and get some more money. (beat) And Victor, this time no problems.
Stella is here again looking at the abstract pictures on wall. One Two joins her, he's got a largish Louis Vuitton with the money and her twenty percent in it.
I know a man that'll copy that for you. Might take him a couple of minutes mind.
You don't need to copy anything any more, welcome to the nouveau riche Mr. One Two.
Here's one for you too Mrs Dexter.
Why thank you Mr. One Two. I see you didn't think much of the black eye though.
Would have liked to obliged, but from a professional point of view, it just wasn't natural,... (pause) Until next time then.
Until next time.
PINK Revision   -   6-20-07                        23A.
She turns and walks away, he looks slyly.
WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07
Handsome Bob is driving.
She's a looker ain't she One Two? One Two picks up his phone and starts to dial.
She's not for you Bob, that is class. Someone picks up at the other end of the phone.
Archy, I got Lenny's bitta scratch.
Turbo is driving Archy, who is on the phone.
What, you got it all?
Yeah and it's burning a hole in the floor, so you better come and get it before it melts my boots.
I'll come round the speeler. Archy's phone beeps - he has an incoming call.
Got another call, gotta go. Archy switches calls.
Lenny is pacing, he's on the phone.
Archy, the Russian didn't come through with the money.
Calm down Len, the Councilor can wait.
PINK Revision    -   6-20-07
(beat) Some good news for you, One Two and Co came through with the scratch.
WHITE Revision   -   6-6-07
What, all of it?
Yeah, all of it.
(surprised)
Where did they get that from then?
Ask no questions hear no lies. (beat)
Just gotta do is find your painting now Len.
Lenny's phone beeps - he has an incoming call.
Just make sure you find it. (beat)
I gotta another call. He switches calls.
The Councilor is on his mobile, speaking in hushed tones.
